Key Match Events: Doumbia scored in the 45+1' for Mali
Nuamah scored in the 58' for Ghana
Ayew scored in the 90+4' for Ghana
Owusu was given a yellow card in the 86' for Ghana
Pre-Game Insights: Mali have been one of the most improved sides in Africa over the last two years and have been tipped to win this group, which will grant them entry to the World Cup for the first time in their history.
Ghana were long regarded as one of the best teams in Africa, but they have been plagued by inconsistent performances in recent years.
Post-Match Reflections: Mali will look to continue their impressive run of form when they face Ghana in gameweek three of the CAF World Cup Qualifiers at Stade 26 Mars on Thursday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mali have won their last two home matches against Ghana, scoring three goals in each game.
Ghana have not won an away match in their last 11, dating back to September 2022.
Others: Mali's captain Hamari Traore is serving a four-match suspension, while Tottenham Hotspur's Yves Bissouma is ruled out due to injury.
Ghana's team captain Andre Ayew was dropped from the squad last month, while Southampton's Kamaldeen Sulemana has returned to the squad after missing the AFCON due to an injury.
